greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n>=0, 0 <= k <= p where p = n-th prime) = Bell(k) mod p (cf. A000110).
comment: N-th row gives Bell numbers mod prime(n) and has length prime(n)+1.
reference: J. Levine and R. E. Dalton, Minimum Periods, Modulo p, of First Order Bell Exponential Integrals, Mathematics of Computation, 16 (1962), 416-423. See Table 2.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 31 2012
